document_title: Frontal sinusitis: Causes, symptoms, treatment and prevention
subsection_content:
Dr. Thuy Hang said that frontal sinusitis can be diagnosed based on clinical symptoms such as runny nose, nasal congestion, headache, forehead pain and history of ENT disease... In addition, the Laboratory testing may also be ordered to confirm the diagnosis of frontal sinusitis.
1. CT and MRI scan
These two methods can indicate the severity of sinusitis and in some cases, can be used for differential diagnosis or finding the cause of the disease. However, these imaging tests are not recommended for uncomplicated cases of acute sinusitis.
2. Nasal endoscopy
The doctor will use an endoscope with a camera inserted deep inside the nose to examine the condition of the nasal cavity and internal sinuses, thereby providing appropriate treatment.
3. Lumbar puncture
This method of obtaining cerebrospinal fluid helps diagnose meningitis. However, lumbar puncture is only indicated when intracranial complications are suspected, after excluding brain abscess by diagnostic imaging methods.
